metadata.title: CVE-2016-9920 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
steps/mail/sendmail.inc in Roundcube before 1.1.7 and 1.2.x before 1.2.3,when no SMTP server is configured and the sendmail program is enabled, doesnot properly restrict the use of custom envelope-from addresses on thesendmail command line, which allows remote authenticated users to executearbitrary code via a modified HTTP request that sends a crafted e-mailmessage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9920` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

roundcube - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-core - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-mysql - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-pgsql - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-plugins - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-sqlite3 - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: roundcube package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.6+dfsg.1-1').
